content.summary:

I'm intestered in participate in the creation and design of web products to combine usability and design properly. I like to do UI, logos, display letters, icons. I have managed projects from logo design, printed and digital branding in commercial stationery, catalogs, graphic identity manuals to websites, interactive presentations and social media campaigns. Also, I have participated and directed projects of static and dynamic websites, implementation of templates in proprietary and open source CMS, development of PWA applications in front-end libraries using HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.
content.story:
I graduated from the Darias Design Institute in 2013. Previously, I studied computer engineering and became interested in web design, to the point that I changed of career. In Darias, I learned the basics of design, typography, illustration, corporate identity, photography, among many other things. I completed HTML / Flash courses and this is how I started making my first web pages.

Â  I worked as director's assistant of Darias Institue in 2008 in charge of the school's website. I participated in the installation of the Latin American typography exhibition Latin Types in the Museum of Design and Prints Carlos Cruz-Diez. That same, year I got my first web designer job and met the content managers; There I started taking the first steps with CSS style sheets to improve the appearance of HTML views.

In October 2014, a website I made for Banco del Libro was selected to participate in the IDB Latin American Design Biennial of the same year in the digital design category. I collaborated in the development and design of the website for the Design Congress [Caracas Design](https://www.facebook.com/groups/caracasdesign/) in its 2013, 2014 and 2015 editions. At the beginning of 2019 I certified myself as a front-end web developer; Since January 2010 I have been director and manager in the areas of design and front-end web development projects at Novanet.

content.title: Athlos logo
content.description:
The name for the brand emerged as a result of an exchange of ideas with the client; The concept for the design started from the geometric construction of the letters, as is the case of the 'A', where the  triangle tis drawn when a square and circle of equal width and height are superimposed. The rest of the letters of the name were created following the same design pattern to make them look like the same design system. From the start of the project, the client was integrated into the creative process, this logo design was very fluid, so the implementation of the brand came naturally.

Graphic identity design for [company] (https://www.instagram.com/athlos.ve/) of sportswear.

content.title: Banco del libro web site
content.description:
The concept for the design is closely related to the shapes of the Bank of the Book logo; from this the disposition between the different elements was established. The aim was to navigate the website in such a way that it invited both children, youth and adults to be interested in the activities carried out by the Banco del Libro.

With all this in mind, an animation was designed and developed on the home page that features the logo and a navigation bar that respond to the interaction of the page visitor. Internal links maintain the same concept of animated menu and content generated through a content manager.

The graphic implementation was done in html / css, Flash animations and the open source CMS used is SilverStripe v2.4.5 (php, mysql), applied jointly to the installation and implementation of the news modules and image gallery. [Link] (http://galerias.bid-dimad.org/bid_14/?p=4191) to the project selection article at the Ibero-American Design Biennial IDB 2014.

content.title: Barahunda display font
content.description:
This display font is inspired by the contrast of the behaviour of the hatitants of Caracas city. Its sharp and rounded forms present in the structure of the design represent two factors that generate opposite positions and that are present in the city: our nobility and aggressiveness, the wide and negative reduced spaces evoke these aspects in a graphic manner.
Each character seeks its own identity in a comfortable way; they try to find their own place in an honest way without sacrificing readability. Because of its wide appearance, barahÃºnda is a display type font, for use in headlines and short texts.

The intention with this typograpy is to have an alphabet (in this case uppercase) that is culturally related to the citizen who participates in the daily life on the capital.

content.title: psi-cocina
content.description:
Psi-cocina, was one of my firsts full CMS installations and frontend implementations. It was a project that arose from the desire of a clinical psychologist to offer and share a space in which people (children, youth and adults) can enjoy the benefits and advances of psychology and psychotherapy in a non-stigmatizing context, enjoyment and practical learning as is cooking. I had the opportunity to personally met and worked with the creator of the idea, so I really fell in love with this amazing project.

The web design was inspired on the manual work involved when working in a kitchen. In that time, the workshops were taken by children on vacation time were on its prime, becasue of this, the intention was to offer a layout for the attractive for parents and fun for the kids. The CMS of choice was Silvestripe, the theme was specifically design and developed for this website.

content.title: Graphic design and web development
content.description:
Addressing web development from a graphic designer's point of view can be complex. In general, in graphic design (or visual communication) a large part of the elements are tangible since we know previously the content of the piece to be designed, its approximate size, we can glimpse what colors and typography to use, among other things.

Graphic design programs are adapted to this nature; if you want to make an ellipse just choose the indicated tool and draw it in the workspace. In contrast, abstract thinking is used in web design to solve the requirements that are presented to us; For example, if we want to change the width of a component in our web view it would be necessary to modify the properties in the CSS style.

The ways to address the change to be made is different because in the graphic design the properties of the ellipse are handled by selecting the element and modifying its properties. On the web it is different because you have to edit a file that aims to give the page a visual style.

That is why I have decided to share information to facilitate the web design learning process and offer interested parties the necessary approach and guidance to start making web pages; Mainly, the content is aimed at graphic designers, amateurs and enthusiasts. It could also be useful for web developers looking to improve the visual style of their web views through the basic design basics.

### What is @flaex_? He is a character inspired by work with scissors, cardboard and paper. The composition of the logo is done manually, similar to the traditional design process before the arrival of the computers.

The graphic identity is complemented by series of ["faces"] (https://flaex.netlify.com/shuffler) made from typographic characters placed in such a way that they create "expressions". It also works as a form relationship exercise.

### Themes
The content I will share through the blog will include the following topics:

** I. What is web design?** - **Graphic design** - Fundamentals. - Logos, printed, typography. - **Web development** - Fundamentals (backend, frontend). - HTML, CSS, JS. - Types of websites (static, web apps, CMS). ** II. Guides ** - ** Graphic design programs ** - Illustrator, Photoshop, Animate, Gimp, Inkscape, FontBase. - ** Web development programs ** - Visual Studio Code, GitHub, Google Chrome Dev Tools. - ** Libraries and frameworks ** - Bootstrap, React, CreateJS. ** II. Reviews ** - Graphic design, web development and information technologies. ### Why this blog?
Mainly the objective is to create content in Spanish for web design and development since the vast majority of information found is in English, which makes learning difficult. Share and interact with people interested in graphic design, web development and new technologies.

content.title: What is web design?
content.description:
The rise and rise of the Internet as a means of disseminating content has placed it as the protagonist in many of our daily activities such as work, studies, recreation and entertainment spaces. Its immediate availability and better use of resources has made it the preferred means of communication for many people and companies that want to publish information of interest either through social networks or websites with specific objectives and functions. Being a mass communication channel, graphic design, through web design, has been integrated into web development projects through a series of technologies that allow us to implement our static designs on functional web pages; It is very important to understand web design as a specialty where two disciplines are mainly combined: graphic design and web development. ## *Graphic design* As defined by Wicius Wong [1] (# fn1) in his book Fundamentals of Design [2] (# fn2) , it is not just a matter of aesthetics :

> * Design is a process of visual creation with a purpose. Unlike painting and sculpture, which are the realization of the personal visions and dreams of an artist, the design covers practical requirements. A graphic design unit must be placed in front of the public's eyes and carry a preset message. An industrial product must meet the needs of the consumer. * In graphic design, factors such as functionality and purpose are taken into account in the creative process; that is, web design is also based on these principles. Visual language seeks to be practical, readable and inform users; Its objective nature is evident. Similarly, it is very important to recognize and understand their role in our society and their purpose as a means of transmitting information; Joan Costa [3] (# fn3) designates it this way in her book Design for the eyes [4] (# fn4) :

> * Its most noble design is to work to improve our visual environment, make the world intelligible and improve the quality of life; provide information and improve things; Disseminate civic causes and collective interest and culture. Its specificity as a discipline is to transmit sensations, emotions and knowledge. * > * While the purpose of graphic design is communication, discipline has its own language for it. It is the basic language of the image and the text. * Knowing its practical nature and its role in the development of society, "graphics" is closely linked to industry and commerce, audiovisual media, marketing and communication sciences. Its growth is directly related to the development of new technologies. Therefore, its association with web development is direct. ## *Web development* Wikipedia defines it on its website [5] (# fn5) as follows: > * It is the activity of developing web applications on the internet or intranet. Web development covers everything from developing simple static text pages to complex web-based applications, e-commerce and social networking services. He is involved in web engineering, web design, content design, client and server side rendering, web servers and network security. * In the case of information technologies, it has been web development that has had the necessary standards to create content through the combination of software tools, databases and web browsers. As I mentioned in a [previous article] (https://flaex.netlify.com/blog/blog-de-@flaex_), addressing web development from a graphic designer's point of view can be complex. Therefore, it is convenient to use abstract thinking to solve the requirements that we face; For example, in web design, the structure of content elements (texts, images) are saved in * HTML * files, their graphic configuration (sizes, colors) in * CSS * files and the code to manage their behavior in * JS * files.
content.seo_description: Web design is a fairly new discipline. What is it and what is its structure? Here we give you the answer

content.title: HMTL & graphic design
content.description:
HMTL (HyperText Markup Language) is the language and main component of the web. Its specification is in charge of The Web World Wide Web Consortium [1] (# fn1) , an international community where its members and the general public work together to develop web standards. W3C [1] (# fn1) defines it as follows:

Â Â  > * HTML is the language to describe the structure of web pages, it gives authors the means to: * > * - Publish documents online with headings, text, tables, lists, photos, among other elements. * > * - Get information online through hypertext links, with the click of a button. * > * - Design forms to carry out transactions with remote services, find information, make reservations, order products, among other tasks. * > * - Include spreadsheets, video clips, sound clips and other applications directly in your documents. *
> * With HTML, the authors describe the structure of the pages using markup tags. The language elements label pieces of content as "titles", "paragraphs", "lists", "tables", "images", among other elements. * In addition to W3C [1] (# fn1) , there are other websites that offer information on web technologies such as MDN Web Docs [2] (# fn2) from Mozilla; A very complete site to learn other related languages. Regarding HTML, this is the way this platform defines it:

> HTML is not a programming language; It is a markup language that defines the structure of a content. HTML consists of a series of elements, used to encapsulate different parts of the content and make them behave in a certain way.
